items.to_string: Title: Stage: Custom Logger Lambda for multi-tenant telemetry in IaC Value Statement: As a BIP-AI engineer who manages centralized logging for Bedrock services, I need the ability to deploy a router Lambda in stage that filters logs by tenant and routes them to tenant-specific log groups, so that each tenant can access only their own logs while maintaining a single ingestion point. Acceptance Criteria: - In Stage, when platform logs are written to the central Bedrock log group, the custom Lambda filters log events by tenant and routes them to the correct tenant-specific log group. - The Lambda is deployed as an IaC resource using Crossplane with appropriate permissions to write to tenant log groups using the tenant’s execution role. - Documentation is updated to reflect the deployment structure and tenant access model for CloudWatch log groups.

Title: Custom Logger Lambda for multi-tenant telemetry in IaC Value Statement: As a BIP-AI engineer who manages centralized logging for Bedrock services, I need the ability to deploy a router Lambda that filters logs by tenant and routes them to tenant-specific log groups, so that each tenant can access only their own logs while maintaining a single ingestion point. Acceptance Criteria: - When platform logs are written to the central Bedrock log group, the custom Lambda filters log events by tenant and routes them to the correct tenant-specific log group. - The Lambda is deployed as an IaC resource using Crossplane with appropriate permissions to write to tenant log groups using the tenant’s execution role. - Documentation is updated to reflect the deployment structure and tenant access model for CloudWatch log groups.

As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need update the Gateway API to support all the updates the Gateway currently has** **A/C:** - Update the Gateway API system to support all the current updates, handle request more efficiently, and update to use HTTP2 if possible.

items.from_string: Develop unified crossplane manager resource retrieval for single pane of glass
items.to_string: Story: As a BIP-AI platform engineer, I want the crossplane manager to retrieve resources from multiple environment clusters into a unified cache organized by environment so that I can manage all crossplane resources through a single pane of glass interface. Assumptions: - The management pod has network access to the crossplane manager APIs in each target environment - Each environment's crossplane manager API is already deployed and accessible via a stable route - SBXMGMT and SBX environments are available for initial testing Acceptance Criteria: - Given multiple environment clusters when determining access requirements then a documented method exists for accessing the retrieve, pause, and unpause routes in each environment - Given the crossplane manager API when manager mode is implemented then it can operate in a unified manner retrieving resources from multiple configured environments - Given environment-specific API base URLs when configured via environment variables then the crossplane manager can retrieve resources from each specified environment - Given a user accessing the gateway from a management cluster when they request resources for a specified environment then the system returns that environment's crossplane resources - Given the SBXMGMT and SBX environments when end-to-end testing is performed then resources can be successfully retrieved from SBX via the SBXMGMT management cluster Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

items.from_string: Plan migration of claims for self-service deployment from tenant config repositories
items.to_string: Story: As a tenant of BIP-AI, I want to deploy my crossplane claims from my tenant config repository so that I can manage my infrastructure deployments through my own CI/CD processes without depending on the central platform team. Assumptions: - Tenants already have configuration repositories with established CI/CD pipelines - The bip-ai API group is a distinct entity that requires explicit authorization for tenant use - Mural is the approved tool for ticket/task tracking for the implementation work - The plan deliverable will be stored in the bip-ai-infrastructure repository Acceptance Criteria: - Given the current tenant crossplane claim process when analysis is performed then the method for adding the bip-ai API group to the authorized list is documented and if the change is a simple PR then the PR is drafted and advertised to Engineering - Given tenant enablement requirements when all steps are identified then a documented procedure exists covering how to enable crossplane claims for a tenant, generate claims in their config repo, and execute the migration process once claims are ready to deploy - Given the enablement procedure when documented then a plan exists in the bip-ai-infrastructure repository detailing the overall approach and prerequisites - Given the plan when implementation work is broken down then tickets for all remaining steps are created in Mural with clear descriptions and dependencies Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted

### Title Deploy Langfuse observability platform to enable LLM application tracing Value Statement As a an Infra Engineer, I need the ability to access a self-hosted Langfuse instance so bip AI users can trace, monitor, and debug LLM application behavior. ### Acceptance Criteria - When a user navigates to Langfuse, the user has the ability to sign up and log in. - Langfuse is deployed in the `bip-ai` namespace on the `sbx-kubernetes` cluster with AWS S3 for storage and ElastiCache for caching. - Documentation is updated in the infrastructure runbook. - Automated or manual tests were added to validate login and trace ingestion. ### Assumptions - The `sbx-kubernetes` cluster is available with sufficient capacity. - AWS Load Balancer Controller is installed on the cluster. ### Dependencies None. ## Notes - Uses Langfuse Helm chart for deployment. - Deployed to `bip-ai` namespace in `sbx-kubernetes` cluster. - AWS S3 for event/media storage, ElastiCache Redis for caching. - PostgreSQL: either chart-deployed (on-cluster) or RDS. - Chart-deployed ClickHouse for initial deployment. - Uses default email/password authentication. ### Out of Scope - Entra ID SSO integration (future consideration with Enterprise Edition). - SCIM user provisioning. - Multi-region / disaster recovery.

items.from_string: Integrate cosign verify Signature Validation Step into Image Builder Pipeline
items.to_string:
As a DevOps engineer or platform team member, I want the image builder pipeline to include a verification step using cosign verify after an image is pushed to ECR or Nexus, so that every container image released by our pipeline is proven to have a valid cryptographic signature from our trusted key, ensuring supply chain security.
The cosign verify command checks that an image in the registry is signed with the specific public key or KMS key we provide. It retrieves all registry-stored signatures associated with the image reference (SHA-based). It confirms that at least one signature matches our signing key. If the signature is present and valid, the signature details and metadata are displayed. If the signature is missing, invalid, or not from our key, verification fails and an explicit error is returned.

Title: 2.2 - Provide adhoc support to Innovation team to resolve technical issues Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant on the Innovation team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays. Acceptance Criteria: When a user from Innovation requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed. Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved. Update deployment dates in Confluence for each support ticket.

items.from_string: Plan IAM role migration to reduce legacy naming length issues
items.to_string: Story: As a BIP-AI Infra cloud engineer, I want to plan the migration of all resources using the current SageMaker domain execution role to the new shorter naming convention role that is already deployed so that we can deprecate the legacy naming convention that causes naming length issues for certain tenants. Assumptions: - The new shorter naming convention execution role is already deployed in each target AWS account/environment and is ready for use by all affected resources - The scope includes all environments where the legacy SageMaker domain execution role is in use (sbx, dev, stage, preprod, prod) unless explicitly excluded - The plan deliverable is a written document stored in a team-accessible location and linked from the ticket Acceptance Criteria: - Given the current environments when discovery is performed then the plan document lists all resource types and concrete resources currently referencing the legacy SageMaker domain execution role - Given an identified resource type when its configuration model is reviewed then the plan document states whether the execution role is mutable/immutable for that resource type and cites the specific mechanism/constraint that drives the conclusion - Given resources where the role reference is immutable when the migration approach is drafted then the plan document includes a safe path for each case (for example recreate/replace strategy) and the expected blast radius - Given the migration steps when tenant impact is assessed then the plan document specifies any expected downtime windows (or confirms no downtime), including best-case/likely/worst-case duration estimates - Given the migration steps when tenant responsibilities are assessed then the plan document lists required tenant actions after the change (if any), along with verification steps tenants can perform to confirm success - Given the overall migration approach when operational rollout is planned then the plan document includes a proposed schedule (phased by environment and/or tenant), prerequisites, and a rollback plan Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit/integration as applicable) - Documentation updated (README / runbook / API docs as applicable) - Telemetry / logging added (if applicable) - Security and access controls reviewed (if applicable) - Dependencies updated and migrations applied (if applicable) - Feature flag (if used) enabled or removal plan noted
This issue is cloned by BIP-30975

items.from_string: This issue is cloned by BIP-30975

items.to_string: Title: Add OTEL module to Bedrock manager in mlkit Value Statement: As an MLOps Engineer who invokes Bedrock agents and foundation models via BedrockManager, I need the ability to capture structured OpenTelemetry traces for agent invocations, model calls, and knowledge base operations so that I can gain deeper observability into agent behavior, debug performance issues, and integrate with existing OTEL-compatible observability platforms. AC: -1. Telemetry Configuration Module When a user instantiates BedrockManager, the user has the ability to optionally enable OpenTelemetry tracing via configuration or environment variables. -Support the following environment variables (matching OTEL standard): OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT - OTLP collector endpoint (optional) OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_HEADERS - Headers for OTLP requests OTEL_SERVICE_NAME - Service name (default: bip-ai-kit) OTEL_SEMCONV_STABILITY_OPT_IN - Semantic convention opt-in values When no OTLP collector is available, the user can enable ConsoleSpanExporter for local trace debugging -2. Agent Invocation Tracing When a user calls invoke_agent(), the user has the ability to see detailed span traces for the entire agent invocation lifecycle. Create parent span invoke_agent \{agent_id} with attributes: gen_ai. operation. name: invoke_agent gen_ai.agent. name: agent_id gen_ai.agent.alias_id: agent_alias_id gen_ai.session.id: session_id gen_ai.user.id: user_id (if provided) gen_ai.correlation. id: correlation_id (if provided) Create child spans for each trace event type parsed from _parse_trace_event(): orchestrationTrace. modelInvocationInput orchestrationTrace.modelInvocationOutput orchestrationTrace.rationale orchestrationTrace.observation orchestrationTrace.knowledgeBaseLookupOutput orchestrationTrace.actionGroupInvocationInput orchestrationTrace.actionGroupInvocationOutput preProcessingTrace postProcessingTrace failureTrace Record gen_ai.event. start_time and gen_ai.event.end_time on each span Record total_time_ms as span attribute on completion On error, set span status to ERROR and record exception 3. Foundation Model Invocation Tracing When a user calls invoke_foundation_model(), the user has the ability to see span traces for model invocations with token usage. Create span chat with attributes: gen_ai.operation.name: chat gen_ai.request.model: f_model_arn gen_ai.inference.profile: i_model_arn gen_ai.request.enable_cache: enable_cache Record input messages as span events using gen_ai.user.message or gen_ai.client.inference.operation.details On completion, record token usage attributes: gen_ai.usage.input_tokens gen_ai.usage.output_tokens gen_ai.usage.total_tokens gen_ai.usage.cache_read_input_tokens (if applicable) gen_ai.usage.cache_write_input_tokens (if applicable) Record response content as span event gen_ai.choice 4. Knowledge Base Operation Tracing When a user calls knowledge base methods, the user has the ability to trace retrieval and generation operations. Create span for retrieve_knowledge_base_chunks(): Span name: retrieve_kb \{kb_id} Attributes: gen_ai.kb.id, gen_ai.kb.query, gen_ai.kb.num_results Record retrieval_results_count on completion Create span for get_knowledge_base_response(): Span name: retrieve_and_generate \{kb_id} Attributes: gen_ai.kb.id, gen_ai.kb.model_arn 5. Metrics Instrumentation When a user enables metrics, the user has the ability to collect quantitative telemetry data. Create singleton BedrockMetricsClient with the following instruments: Counters: bedrock. agent.invoke_count bedrock.model.invoke_count bedrock.kb.retrieve_count bedrock.agent.error_count Histograms: bedrock.agent.duration (ms) bedrock.model.duration (ms) bedrock.model.input_tokens bedrock.model.output_tokens bedrock.kb.retrieve_duration (ms) Metrics can be exported to console or OTLP (when collector available) 6. BedrockManager Integration When a user uses BedrockManager, the user has the ability to transparently get tracing without code changes. Add optional telemetry parameter to BedrockManager.__init__(): Python def __init__(self, aws_account=None, tenant=None, telemetry: BedrockTelemetry = None): Add _tracer property that lazily initializes tracer Existing invoke_agent() method instruments traces when telemetry is enabled Existing invoke_foundation_model() method instruments traces when telemetry is enabled Backward compatible - no breaking changes to existing API 9. Documentation When a user reads the documentation, the user has the ability to understand how to enable and configure telemetry. Add docstrings to all new telemetry classes and methods Create docs/telemetry. md with: Overview of telemetry capabilities Configuration options and environment variables Example usage patterns Console exporter usage (for no-collector scenarios) OTLP collector setup guide (for future use) Update README.md with telemetry section 10. Testing When a user runs tests, the user has the ability to verify telemetry functionality. Unit tests for BedrockTracer span lifecycle methods Unit tests for BedrockTelemetry configuration Integration test demonstrating console export (no collector required) Mock tests for BedrockManager methods with telemetry enabled Assumptions The business will confirm the preferred OTEL_SERVICE_NAME default value prior to implementation OpenTelemetry Python SDK packages (opentelemetry-api, opentelemetry-sdk, opentelemetry-exporter-otlp-proto-http) will be added to project dependencies Dependencies None - this story can proceed independently since console exporter works without a collector Notes The Strands Agents SDK (strands-agents/sdk-python) telemetry module was used as a reference implementation Console exporter enables local debugging and development without requiring OTLP collector infrastructure When OTLP collector becomes available, users simply set OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT environment variable The existing log_traces parameter in invoke_agent() can be extended to also control OTEL span creation

Title: Create basic strands notebook to reflect OTEL module Value Statement: As an MLE who wants tenants to use OpenTelemetry, I want to show how to use OTEL in a tenant notebook. AC: Create notebook in tenant-resources that demonstrates how to use the OTEL module in a basic strands agent. Telemetry should print to console

Title: TERA: Load test TERA API Gateway in prod Value Statement: As a TERA user and MLOps Engineer I want to make sure the prod API Gateway can handle the additional traffic expected with the "On page load" changes expected in release 40.5. This ticket is to test the prod API Gateway with anticipated spike traffic and determine if the Opensearch queue will be able to handle the additional concurrent requests. AC: - prod API Gateway load tested during off-hours with anticipated requests for 5 and 30 min intervals

As a DevOps engineer supporting BIP AI multi-tenant deployments, I want the tenant-agnostic BIP AI Tenant Master Pipeline to call the Lambda Deployment pipeline, So that I can deploy/update tenant-specific Lambda functions consistently from a single orchestrating pipeline with standard inputs, controls, and traceability.
BIP AI Tenant Master Pipeline includes a stage/job to trigger the Lambda Deployment pipeline from within the tenant-agnostic pipeline.
items.to_string:
**Value Statement** As a DevOps Engineer, I want to create a Harness Template for SageMaker pipelines , so that we can deploy and manage SageMaker pipelines directly from Harness.

**Acceptance Criteria:** - The pipeline is modular and templatized, allowing easy customization and reuse. - The pipeline is saved as a Harness template and documented for other users to pull and use. - Permissions and secrets are managed securely in Harness. - Documentation is provided for how to use and modify the pipeline template. - The pipeline is validated by running at least one end-to-end SM pipeline deployment.

Acceptance Criteria
User gets the correct response from DEV endpoint.

items.from_string:
As a platform/DevOps engineer supporting BIP AI multi-tenant deployments, I want a tenant-agnostic “BIP AI Tenant Master Pipeline” that calls the existing Image Builder pipeline, So that I can reliably kick off tenant-specific image builds from a single orchestrating pipeline with consistent parameters, governance, and traceability.
Pipeline “BIP AI Tenant Master Pipeline” exists in the tenant-agnostic area and is manually runnable.
Pipeline is tenant-agnostic (no tenant-specific hardcoding); changing tenantId does not require code changes.
Pipeline triggers the Image Builder pipeline exactly once per master pipeline run (when validation passes).
Master pipeline outputs the downstream Image Builder run ID/build number and a link/URL to the downstream run.

items.from_string:
As a DevOps engineer / Release engineer I want the existing image promotion pipeline to promote container images for AWS ECR (from dev to stage) So that we have a consistent, automated, and auditable way to move images from development to staging environments.
 
AC: We currently have an image promotion pipeline, but it does not fully support promoting images between ECR repositories. The pipeline accepts an image identifier (e.g., repo name + tag, or digest) as input for promotion. ECR promotion (dev → stage) runs as part of, or as a stage in, the existing image promotion pipeline. The trigger conditions for promotion are clearly defined (e.g., only for specific tags/patterns or after a manual approval).
items.to_string:
As a Platform/DevOps engineer I want to build and publish a standardized container image specifically for the image promotion pipeline So that the promotion pipeline runs in a consistent, secure, and reproducible runtime environment.
 
Container image is created Dockerfile (or equivalent) exists in the approved repo/location Image includes all required promotion tooling (as defined by pipeline needs)

items.from_string:

Title: Update FastAPI Docs For ARIA

Value Statement: As a ml engineer I want to make sure all documentation of the ARIA API is updated so that other teams wanting to integrate can have accurate details.

AC: all functions docstrings are updated so the fast api docs are up to date.
